function_phrase: So, the key takeaway is this:
main_point: The professor explains Ceramic petrography and provenance and how to interpret evidence when measurements can be misleading.
detail1: The professor distinguishes assemblage (a process) from stratigraphy (a proxy/measurement).
detail2: He suggests testing an asymmetric prediction involving context and radiocarbon dating.
attitude: Casual but analytical; he warns against over-trusting a neat correlation.
organization_point: He adds a tangent about a tools tangent to show real-world constraints.
connecting_point: The example about controlling for provenance shows how bias can flip an apparent pattern.
